What Lies Beneath

Looking into the river from the dock above, I see a stick poking up through the brackish water. Angus crouches into a pounce position, ready to fetch as soon as I release the taut leash. Alongside the dock, my fiance sits in the boat, waiting for us to board.

Presidents join Georgetowner for Burger Lunch

Georgetowner Ada Polla was joined by President Barack Obama and Russian President Dmitry Medvedev for burger lunch as the presidents took a break between bilateral meetings at the White House Thursday.

Likely recipients of new Georgetown liquor licenses revealed

Yesterday’s Georgetown Current contained an article discussing the decision by the ABC Board to expand the available liquor licenses within the Georgetown Moratorium by seven.

ANC Preview: No Left Turn, Yet Edition

Next Monday the ANC will meet for their July session. It will be their last meeting until September, so this is the last call for project approval for two months.

Georgetown Farmers Meet Market in Rose Park

If it's Wednesday, you'll find neighbors, kids, dogs, tennis and basketball players all converge at Rose Park where a producer-only market is The Villages' answer to "What's for dinner (or breakfast)?"

Apple of their Eye: Crowds line Wisconsin to welcome D.C.'s first

Apple opened its first store in the District -- in Georgetown of course, more than two and a half years after buying a prime Wisconsin Avenue building. The store, at 1229 Wisconsin Ave. NW, previously occupied by the French Connection, opened Friday at 5 p.m.

I spent this past weekend on Martha’s Vineyard. Apart from several trips to Newport for hotel work a decade ago, I haven't spent any time in New England. I tend to migrate west for family get-togethers and downtime.

Bend It Like...

It’s world cup time—and that can mean one thing… yes, Wise Guy, I know it means soccer.

Power in baldness

“Whatever you can do, or dream you can do, begin it. Baldness has genius, power, and magic in it” This is a great quote attributed to Goethe, and I ran across it on a real estate web site. If you look at my picture on my blog you will note that I am bald.

Rain or Shine, Georgetown Gathers at Martin's

A motto for Georgetowners, Disherati, and the George Washington Tennis Center alike -- rain or shine, flood, fire, snow. There is no place like Martin's.

California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger had every right to be in a very good mood at last night’s Washington premiere of “Gerrymandering” at the E Street Cinema presented by The Impact Arts & Film Fund and Green Film Company.

Shoot For Change

Walter Grio opened his first D.C. photography exhibit at Peacock Café this week. Grio has become a philanthropic inspiration for his creation of an amazing program called Shoot for Change.

Construction Fatigue in North Georgetown?

Last month the new Safeway opened up at 1855 Wisconsin Ave. This was a huge construction project for Georgetown, but it was just one of many construction projects either complete or on the drawing board for upper Georgetown.

To Die For

Barking For The Washington Humane Society

The Washington Hilton went to the dogs on Saturday night as over 600 guests , many with their pets, equally well attired, donned black tie for the 23rd Annual Bark Ball to benefit The Washington Humane Society.

Evans sounds alarm on D.C. budget

Amid growing concern that the District's finances are headed for disaster, D.C. Council member Jack Evans voted against the budget for the first time in his 20 years on the Council -- the only Council member to vote against the budget when it passed last week.

S A T C

On the tail end of the Memorial holiday, I have had very

few things on my mind this extended weekend except sun,

fun, friends and frolicking. So what better way to finish off

the forthcoming four day work week, but with four letters ...

Just Say It

Words. We use them every day. I’m using them now. “Duh.” You say. But as this week begins with Memorial Day, and as last words; parting phrases and final memories are in the spotlight, there’s no better time than this to consider them.

Frescoes of Georgetown: A Walking Tour

ANC Preview: Any Objections?

The ANC will meet for it’s June meeting next Tuesday at 6:30 at Visitation. Looking at the agenda, you’d think the entire meeting will be dominated by liquor license renewals. But GM predicts little time will actually be spent on those issues. So what will they be talking about?
